page.title: 06SEWERBY HALL 2
page.content: The building also houses a restaurant and snack bar. In the nearby Clock Tower is a licensed bar and there is a gift shop in what used to be a stable block. The grounds are made up of parkland and ornamental gardens but now contain a variety of leisure amenities. The front of the house looks onto large lawns dotted with trees which extend to within 200m of the cliff top. Between the grounds and the cliff is the village cricket pitch, separated by a sunken wall known as a ha-ha. In earlier times it prevented sheep and cattle from coming too close to the house and yet remained out of site and did not spoil the view of Bridlington Bay. The rose gardens are laid out in a symmetrical pattern and the Old English Walled garden contains a wide variety of plants including figs and peaches.
